transportAdvice: Carmel Valley is best explored by car, as attractions including wineries and hiking trails are spread across a rural area. The village of Carmel-by-the-Sea itself is walkable, but reaching Carmel Valley's inland areas requires driving.

weather.description: Cool and rainy with lush green hillsides; a good time for wine tasting indoors.
Continued rain with warming trends; wildflowers start to bloom toward month's end.
Spring arrives with decreasing rain and pleasant temperatures for hiking.
Mild and mostly dry with wildflowers in bloom across the valley.
Warm inland days with coastal fog; excellent conditions for outdoor wine tasting.
Warm and dry in the valley, with morning coastal fog burning off by midday.
Hot and sunny in the valley with very little rain; perfect for vineyard visits.
Peak summer warmth continues with clear skies and excellent conditions for outdoor activities.
Often the warmest month with harvest season in full swing at local wineries.
Beautiful Indian summer with warm days and the tail end of grape harvest season.
Cooling temperatures with the return of autumn rains; quieter and more relaxed.
Cool and wet with holiday festivities in nearby Carmel village.
